translation: I am Han Zijun, a climber.
transcript: 我是韩子君，是一名攀登者。

translation: Now my life is like this: every day I climb on steep cliffs and walk through the dangerous glaciers.
transcript: 我现在的生活状态是每天在陡峭的山崖上攀爬，在岌岌可危的冰川中穿行。

translation: Pain and death are all part of the climb.
transcript: 伤痛、死亡都是攀登的一部分。

translation: The poor man lying in the sleeping bag is me.
transcript: 那个躺在睡袋里面，可怜巴巴的人就是我。

translation: But every day I'm happy and determined.
transcript: 但是每一天我都是快乐的，我的内心是笃定的。

translation: I am very satisfied with my current state.
transcript: 我对于现在的状态很满足。

translation: But a year ago, I was not as calm and poised as I am now.
transcript: 但是在一年之前，我的状态并不是现像现在这样完全沉下来的。

translation: In the past two years, I have been on the covers of many fashion magazines, interviewed by a lot of TV stations, interview programs, documentaries, participated in some movies and won some awards.
transcript: 在过去的两年中，我上过很多的时尚杂志，上过很多的电视、访谈、纪录片、也有一些电影，然后也得过一些奖项。

translation: I think this past period may be a reward to my four years of climbing or a summary to it.
transcript: 我觉得过去的这段时间，可能是对我过去四年中的攀登的呃一个回报，或者是一个总结。

translation: I climbed the first snowy mountain in my life in May 2013.
transcript: 我从2013年的5月份开始攀登人生中的第一座雪山。

translation: Since then, in the ensuing five years, I climbed 20 snow-capped mountains of 5,000 to 8,000 meters and reached the top of Mount Everest twice in 2016 and 2017 respectively.
transcript: 在短短的五年时间中，已经攀登了20座5000到8000米的雪山，并且在2016年和2017年两次登顶珠穆朗玛峰。

translation: Becoming the first and only Chinese woman to do so from both the south and north slopes of Mount Everest.
transcript: 是中国第一位也是唯一一位分别从珠峰的南坡和北坡登顶的女性。

translation: I've also climbed the highest peaks in Asia, Africa, Oceania, Europe, and South America.
transcript: 而且我也攀登过亚洲、非洲、大洋洲、欧洲、南美洲的最高峰。

translation: And in the April of this year, I reached the North Pole on foot.
transcript: 并且在今年的4月份徒步到达了北极点。

translation: In the coming November, I will travel to the remote Antarctic to climb its highest mountain, the Vinson Massif.
transcript: 嗯在即将到来的11月，我又要去往遥远的南极大陆，去攀登南极洲的最高峰文森峰。

translation: And ski to the South Pole to realize my dream of climbing the highest peaks of the seven continents and walking to the North and South poles on foot.
transcript: 以及滑雪到达南极点，继续完成我攀登七大洲最高峰的梦想，以及徒步到达南北极点的梦想。

translation: I call it climbing career for it's only 5 years long.
transcript: 对于我来说，我的攀登生涯，呃只有五年我就叫它生涯吧。

translation: It is not a smooth ride.
transcript: 并不是一帆风顺。

translation: In 2015, I witnessed a big disaster and brushed past death.
transcript: 在2015年的时候，我经历过一次很大的灾难，与死神擦肩而过。

translation: On April 25, 2015, an earthquake of magnitude 8.1 struck Nepal, the largest earthquake in South Asia that had ever happened in the last 80 years and caused more than 10,000 deaths.
transcript: 在2015年的4月25日，尼泊尔发生了8.1级的地震，这场南亚80年以来最大的地震造成了尼泊尔1万多人死亡。

translation: On the day of the earthquake, I happened to be in Nepal, in the base camp situated at the south slope of Mount Everest and was ready to climb the Mount Everest.
transcript: 在发生地震的当天，我刚好在尼泊尔，在尼泊尔的珠峰南坡大本营，准备攀登珠穆朗玛峰。

translation: When the earthquake struck, it was 11:56 am in Nepal.
transcript: 当地震来袭的那一刻，是尼泊尔当地时间中午的11点56分。

translation: My teammates and I were preparing for lunch in the tent.
transcript: 我和我的队友们正在帐篷里准备吃午饭。

translation: When the earthquake came, and the mountain started shaking, all the people rushed out of the tent in horror because we didn't know what happened.
transcript: 当地动山摇的一刻来临的时候，所有的人都异常惊恐地冲出帐篷，因为我们不知道发生了什么事。

translation: When we rushed out of the tent, we saw the sky smothered in white snow nearly covering the sun.
transcript: 当我们冲出帐篷的一刻，看到漫天的白雪，真的是遮天蔽日。

translation: The snow mixed with ice and stones fell on us.
transcript: 雪夹杂着冰、夹杂着石块向我们扑来。

translation: Out of human instinct, all of us ran in the opposite direction.
transcript: 出于人的反本本能，我们所有的人就往相反的方向跑。

translation: But probably after we ran two or three steps, I felt someone giving me a heavy push.
transcript: 但是可能大概跑了两三步，我就觉得好像有人在我后背上重重地推了一把。

translation: Then I fell to the ground.
transcript: 我摔倒在地上。

translation: It seemed as if stones, snow and other things pounding on my back, it was painful, I had trouble catching up my breath, and I was trapped in pain of the suffocation.
transcript: 紧接着好像就是有石头、雪、噼里啪啦的东西砸在我的背上，非常非常的疼，而我好像也要喘不过气来，被窒息感深深地困扰着。

translation: When I thought I was going to lose my breath and about to die, suddenly it stopped.
transcript: 当我觉得，我就快要喘不上气，就快要被憋死的时候，突然一切戛然而止。

translation: When I started to move my hands and feet slowly from the snow, it hurt terribly, but the pain was still tolerable.
transcript: 当我从雪地中慢慢地开始活动我的手和脚，很疼，但是那种疼还可以忍受。

translation: I knew I had no fractures, so I slowly got up from the snow.
transcript: 我知道我应该没有骨折，所以我慢慢地从雪地里爬起来。

translation: But when I opened my eyes, the scene in front of me completely shocked me.
transcript: 但是当我睁开眼睛的时候，我眼前的一幕彻底把我惊呆了。

translation: What you see now is the scene in front of me back then.
transcript: 大家现在看到的这一幕，就是我当时眼前的那一幕。

translation: My teammates, full of horror, some with blood on their faces, some with bodies in twisted, strange angles, and some sitting on the ground, not knowing what happened.
transcript: 我的队友七七八八地出现在我的面前，满脸惊恐，有的人满脸是血，有的人腿已经扭曲成了很奇怪的角度，还有的队员就呆呆地坐在地上，完全不知道发生了什么事情。

translation: At Everest Base Camp, which is in fact a normal village.
transcript: 在珠峰大本营，好像是一个村庄。

translation: Every year, April and May are the climbing season when one or two thousand climbers from all over the world and those who serve these climbers come and live here for two months。
transcript: 每年在四五月份的攀登季节，会有一两千名来自世界各地的攀登者以及为这些攀登者服务的人在这里生活两个月。

translation: Turning the Everest Base Camp into an international village.
transcript: 所以珠峰大本营在这两个月就是一个国际村。

translation: At the moment of the avalanche, it was a village full of tents.
transcript: 在雪崩来临的那一刻，还是一个满满当当、帐篷林立的村庄。

translation: But after a dozen seconds, everything changed.
transcript: 但是十几秒钟之后，一切都改变了。

translation: All the tents were missing, and the entire camp was razed to the ground.
transcript: 所有的帐篷不翼而飞，整个营地被划夷为平地。

translation: I was very curious at the time, what were my teammates like?
transcript: 当时我很好奇，我的队友是那样？

translation: And what was I like myself?
transcript: 我自己又是什么样子呢？

translation: So I took out my phone, turned on the front camera, and then I saw myself.
transcript: 所以我拿出手机，把它调到了自拍，然后了我看到了屏幕中的自己。

translation: But the moment when I saw myself, it was really awkward.
transcript: 但是看到自己这一刻的时候，那种感觉真的很奇怪。

translation: At that time, my face was full of blood and I was horrified.
transcript: 我现在想起来，当时脸上满脸是血，很惊恐。

translation: Blood dripped down from the tip of my nose.
transcript: 鼻尖上还在一滴一滴地往下滴着鲜血。

translation: But I didn't sense any pain.
transcript: 但是我却完全没有感到疼痛。

translation: Now I think, I was too shocked at that time to realize my pain.
transcript: 我现在想起来，那个时候我应该被是被震傻了吧，已经完全顾不上疼痛了。

translation: This huge disaster has taken away a total of 19 lives in the entire Everest Base Camp.
transcript: 这场巨大的灾难，一共造成了整个珠峰大本营一共夺去了19条生命。

translation: My team suffered the most with five members from different countries killed, including a Chinese.
transcript: 我所在的队伍更是重灾区，有五位来自不同国家的队友遇难，其中就包括一名中国人。

translation: After the earthquake and avalanche on the 25th, we were not able to leave Everest Base Camp and did not receive any rescue.
transcript: 25日地震和雪崩发生之后，我们并没有能够离开珠峰大本营，没有得到救援。

translation: Why was that?
transcript: 为什么？

translation: Because the weather was very terrible that day.
transcript: 因为那天的天气非常非常的糟糕。

translation: As there were flurries of snow in the sky, helicopters could not come in and rescue us.
transcript: 天下着小雪，没有直升机能够进来救援我们。

translation: Everyone was trapped in the base camp and as if we were trapped in a lonely island.
transcript: 所有人被困在了大本营，困在一座孤岛里面。

translation: Many friends asked me afterwards, at that the moment of the avalanche, were you afraid?
transcript: 很多朋友事后问我，说，雪崩来临的一刻，你害怕吗？

translation: I said, I was not afraid, because I had no time to.
transcript: 我说，我不害怕，因为你根本没有时间害怕。

translation: At that moment, things happened too fast.
transcript: 一切都来得太快了。

translation: But the time during which I was really scared of was not the moment when the avalanche came。
transcript: 但我真正最害怕的时候其实并不是雪崩来的那一刻。

translation: But the time from the end of the avalanche, around 12 o'clock on the 25th, to the morning of the 26th when we left the Everest Base Camp.
transcript: 而是从雪崩结束之后，25号的可能中午12点左右，一直到26号早晨我们离开珠峰大本营那段时间。

translation: Because after a huge earthquake, the aftershocks would follow.
transcript: 因为大的地震过后，不停地余震。

translation: Each aftershock will induce avalanches, large or small.
transcript: 每一次余震都会引发大大小小的雪崩。

translation: We were fully aware of the danger, and we were in great fear, but there was nothing we can do.
transcript: 而我们这群人明明知道自己身陷于危险之中，陷于巨大的恐惧之中，但是你却无能为力。

translation: There was no way you could get away from this.
transcript: 你完全没有办法逃离这里。

translation: Everyone was consumed by great fear and helplessness, including me.
transcript: 对于每一个人，都被巨大的恐惧感和无助感吞噬着，包括我。

translation: At that time, I temporarily lived in the tent together with other wounded people.
transcript: 当时我和其他的伤员一起被临时安置在帐篷里面。

translation: Every time when the aftershocks struck, I could not move in the sleeping bag because of the pain of my body.
transcript: 所以每一次当余震来临的时候，因为全身的疼痛，我躺在睡袋里面完全不能动弹。

translation: I was terrified even by the slightest tremor under me.
transcript: 当我身底下传来微微的颤动的时候，我都惊恐万分。

translation: I covered my ears and listened to which direction the avalanche came from and judged if it was coming to my direction?
transcript: 然后支着耳朵，听雪崩从哪个方向来，是不是会冲到我这里。

translation: For every aftershock, I was panicked as if a frightened bird.
transcript: 对每一次余震，每一次惊恐，像惊弓之鸟一样。

translation: This feeling is something that I never want to experience again in my life, neither do I want to recall it again.
transcript: 这种感觉，我觉得一辈子都不想再经历，也不想再回忆。

translation: The night of the 25th may be the longest and coldest night I have ever experienced in my life.
transcript: 25号的夜晚，可能是我一生中经历过的最漫长、最寒冷的夜晚。

translation: Because all the tents and material supplies were damaged in the avalanche, I had only the thin clothes I wore during the day.
transcript: 因为所有的帐篷和物资都在雪崩中损毁了，我的身上当时只穿着白天的非常单薄的衣服。

translation: Later I found some very incompatible down jackets and shoes in the ruins, and put them on, but I still felt very cold.
transcript: 然后在废墟里面捡了一些很不合体的羽绒服和鞋子，但是依然非常的寒冷。

translation: At the base of Mount Everest which was situated at an altitude of 5,400 meters, the temperature could go down to minus 20 degrees in the evening.
transcript: 在海拔5400米的珠峰大本营，晚上的时候气温会达到零下20度。

translation: So on such a long, cold night, everyone struggled until six o'clock the next morning, when I heard the arrival of the first helicopter.
transcript: 所以在这样一个漫长、寒冷的夜晚中，每个人都苦苦地煎熬了一夜，直到第二天早晨六点钟，我听到第一架直升飞机到来的时候。

translation: At that moment, I could really feel the hope of life.
transcript: 那时候才觉得真的有了生的希望。

translation: The first day I chose to become a climber, the experienced climbers, the mountaineering coaches, and the guides told me that "success, failure, and death are all part of mountaineering."
transcript: 在我选择登山的第一天开始，我就听前辈们、听登山教练们、听向导们说过，成功、失败、死亡都是登山的一部分。

translation: But this time in 2015, it was the first time since I started climbing, I felt that death was so close to me.
transcript: 但是2015年这一次，是我登山以来第一次真真切切地感受到了死亡与我如此之近。

translation: I felt that the grand power of nature and the insignificance and helplessness of people in front of it.
transcript: 感受到了自然的力量是如此之宏大，在它面前人是如此的渺小、无助。

translation: So after having experienced this disaster, I feel that for me, it is like a rebirth after death.
transcript: 所以在经历了这一次灾难之后，我觉得于我而言，是一次重生，向死而生。

translation: After returning to Kathmandu, I had eight stitches on my forehead and an open wound.
transcript: 回到加德满都之后，我的额头上缝了八针，有一个开放性的外伤。

translation: But when I returned to China, the doctor found that I had fracture in not only my nose but also in my right elbow.
transcript: 但是回国之后，陆续检查出鼻梁骨折、右手肘骨折。

translation: After a series of surgery and half a year of rehabilitation, by the end of 2015, when I heard that Everest Climber Team was rallying members for 2016, I couldn’t sit still.
transcript: 在经历了一系列的手术和半年的康复之后，到了2015年的年底，当我听说2016年攀登珠峰的队伍又在召集人马的时候，我有点坐不住了。

translation: Because I feel that the reason of me not being able to reach Mount Everest in 2015 was not about me.
transcript: 因为我觉得，2015年没能去登珠峰，并不是我个人的原因。

translation: In order to climb Mount Everest, I had prepared for three years.
transcript: 为了攀登珠峰，我已经准备了三年的时间。

translation: I had spent three years training myself, learning mountaineering skills, as well as preparing the funds.
transcript: 三年的训练、三年的各种登山技能的学习，以及资金的储备。

translation: Because climbing Mount Everest is not an easy task.
transcript: 因为攀登珠峰并不是一件很容易的事。

translation: It takes a one-time expense of about 400,000 RMB to climb.
transcript: 差不多需要40万人民币攀登一次。

translation: So at the end of 2015, when I saw the recruitment advertisement, I couldn't resist myself.
transcript: 所以当2015年底的时候，当我看到这个征集队员的广告的时候，我又蠢蠢欲动了。

translation: But the most difficult thing for me at the time was not to convince myself, but to convince my family.
transcript: 但是当时对我来说，最难的并不是说服自己，而是说服我的家人。

translation: I remember in 2015, when I got home, my mother opened the door.
transcript: 我记得2015年，当我回到家，我的母亲打开门的时候。

translation: I was very embarrassed at the time, because my face was full of scars and swollen, with gauze wrapped around my head.
transcript: 当时我非常忐忑，因为我的脸上满是伤痕，头上缠着纱布，整个脸肿得像猪头一样。

translation: I was particularly ashamed to see my family, because when the earthquake in Nepal struck, my family was very worried.
transcript: 我特别羞愧去见我的家人，因为整个尼泊尔地震期间，都让我的家人担心极了。

translation: My mother could not sleep during those nights.
transcript: 我的母亲每一晚每一晚都没有办法入睡。

translation: So when I got home, my mother opened the door and hugged me, and gently patted me.
transcript: 所以当我回到家的时候，当我母亲打开门抱着我，轻轻地拍着我。

translation: When I was crying in her arms, the first thing my mother said to me was, "Don’t cry. Go there when you are fully recovered."
transcript: 我在她怀里哭泣的时候，我的母亲对我说的第一句话是，不要哭，好了再去。

translation: So when I decided that I would like to climb Mount Everest again, I felt that the most difficult thing for me was to face my family.
transcript: 所以当我再决定我又想去爬珠峰的时候，我觉得最难面对是我的家人。

translation: And I am very grateful for my family who understood, supported and encouraged me to continue fulfilling my dream when I told them my idea.
transcript: 但是我非常感谢我的家人，当我跟他们说了这个想法的时候，他们非常理解我，非常支持我，也鼓励我，让我继续去完成自己的梦想。

translation: So in 2016, I chose to start from the north slope of Mount Everest in Tibet and spent two months climbing, experiencing the hardships of altitude sickness, coldness and repeated training.
transcript: 于是2016年，我选择了从西藏珠穆朗玛峰的北坡，经历了两个月的漫长的攀登，经历了高反、寒冷、反复拉练的辛苦。

translation: At 8:20 am on May 20th, 2016, I finally reached the highest peak in the world: Mount Everest.
transcript: 在2016年的5月20号的早上8点20分，我终于登上了世界最高峰：珠穆朗玛峰。

translation: When I reached the peak of Mount Everest, in fact, before that, I fantasized many times my reaction when I climbed to the top, would I cry?
transcript: 当我登顶珠穆朗玛峰的时候，其实在此之前，我幻想过很多次，我登顶的时候会哭吗？会流泪吗？会有什么样的反应吗？

translation: I remember the reaction of my teammates, who reached the top at the same time.
transcript: 我记得我当时的队友，跟我差不多同时间登顶的队友。

translation: A male teammate kneeled down and kowtowed at the top.
transcript: 有一个男队友是趴在顶峰磕头。

translation: And some of our female teammates shed tears.
transcript: 然后我们有的女队友是流下了眼泪。

translation: The moment I stood on the top, I was very calm, and I said to myself silently, here I am finally.
transcript: 而我站到顶上的那一刻，我却异常的平静，只是心里默默地跟自己说，我终于来了。

translation: Then I looked around 360 degrees and enjoyed the scenery at the world's highest altitude that was presented only for me.
transcript: 然后慢慢地360度旋转，旋顾四周，尽情地欣赏着世界上最高的风景，只为我展现的风景。

translation: So after reaching the peak in 2016, I felt that I had already arrived at the climax of my life and reached a height that was difficult to surpass in the future.
transcript: 所以在2016年第一次登顶之后，我觉得我好像已经登顶了我的人生，达到了人生的一个可能以后很难超越的一个高度。

translation: So various interviews and reports came to me.
transcript: 所以各种采访、报道纷至沓来。

translation: At the end of 2016, when I saw the Everest Recruitment Ad again, a very crazy idea came to me again.
transcript: 2016年年底的时候，当我再次看到珠峰征集令的时候，一个很疯狂的想法又跳了出来。

translation: I thought that I wanted to go to Everest again.
transcript: 我说我还想再去珠峰。

translation: When I had this idea, I even doubted if I was crazy.
transcript: 当我有这个想法的时候，我自己都觉得我自己是不是疯了。

translation: Because for this mountain, I have already paid too much, time, energy, and money.
transcript: 因为为了这座山，你已经付出了太多，时间、精力、钱。

translation: Every climb is very dangerous, as if holding your head in your hand.
transcript: 每一次攀登，都是把头像拎在手里一样，非常非常的危险。

translation: But I knew that this time I would climb for myself, only.
transcript: 但是我知道，这一次的攀登，是真真正正地为了我自己的攀登。

translation: In 2015, five of my teammates were killed in the avalanche.
transcript: 因为2015年的时候有五位队友在雪崩中遇难。

translation: So in 2016, when I reached the top in Tibet, I wore a blue Hada on my neck.
transcript: 所以2016年，当我从西藏登顶的时候，我的脖子上戴了一条蓝色的哈达。

translation: I brought this Hada to the peak of Mount Everest and brought it back.
transcript: 我把这条哈达带上了珠峰的顶，又把它带回来。

translation: In October of 2016, when I went to Nepal on foot, I left it at Everest Base Camp.
transcript: 在2016年的10月份，我去尼泊尔徒步的时候，把它留在了珠峰大本营。

translation: I think this Hada and my 2016 climb were for my teammates and those strangers who died in the earthquake and avalanche.
transcript: 我觉得这个哈达和我2016年的攀登，就是为了我那些遇难的队友，以及那些所有不认识的，因为这场地震和雪崩遇难的人。

translation: I felt that when I returned to Nepal in 2016 to leave this Hada in the Everest base camp, the story should have been over already.
transcript: 我觉得当我2016年回到尼泊尔，去把这条哈达留在珠峰大本营的时候，故事应该完结了。

translation: I think it was about time I let it go.
transcript: 我觉得我的心应该能放下了。

translation: But when I saw the recruitment for the Everest climb at the end of 2016, this crazy idea jumped to me again.
transcript: 但当2016年底我又看到珠峰攀登的召集令的时候，这个疯狂的念头一下子又跳上来。

translation: I knew that this story was not over yet.
transcript: 我知道这个故事还没有完。

translation: I must go back to the place where this story began and let it end there.
transcript: 我一定要回到故事开始的地方，让它真真正正地结束。

translation: So in 2017, I wanted to do this climb just for myself, and draw a full stop to this story.
transcript: 所以2017年，我要真真正正地给自己一个攀登，让我自己内心的这个故事给它画上一个圆满的句号。

translation: So in 2017, I returned to the south slope of Everest Base Camp in Nepal.
transcript: 所以在2017年的时候，我又回到了尼泊尔珠峰大本营的南坡。

translation: I remember when I got off the bus, arriving at the Kathmandu Hotel, the first person to meet me was one of my teammates, a Japanese woman.
transcript: 我记得当我到达加德满都酒店的时候，当我下车的时候，迎接我的第一个人是一位日本女队友。

translation: At the moment when the avalanche came in 2015, the two of us were holding hands and running out together, but because of the avalanche, we were broken apart.
transcript: 在2015年的时候雪崩来临的那一刻，我们两个是手牵着手一起往外跑，但是因为雪崩的气浪，我们俩被冲飞了。

translation: On April 26, 2015, the two of us were rescued to Kathmandu on the same plane and sent to hospital by the same ambulance.
transcript: 在2015年4月26日，我们俩乘坐着同一架飞机被救援到加德满都，又上了同一架救护车去的医院。

translation: At that time, my Japanese teammate had two broken legs and she was very painful.
transcript: 当时这位日本女队友两条腿骨折，非常非常的痛苦。

translation: In the ambulance, the two of us held each other's hands tightly to give each other strength.
transcript: 在救护车上，我们两个紧紧地抓着手，我抓着她的手，给彼此以力量。

translation: So when I returned to Kathmandu in 2017, when the first person I saw at the hotel was my Japanese teammate, we both cried.
transcript: 所以当2017年，当我回到加德满都之后，在酒店的门口看到迎出来的第一个人就是这位日本女队友的时候，我们两个抱头痛哭。

translation: When we both returned to Everest Base Camp for the 2017 climb, I lived in a tent with her.
transcript: 当我们两个重新返回到珠峰大本营，为了2017年重新攀登的时候，我和她住在一个帐篷。

translation: During the break, I saw dense wounds on her leg, extending from the calf to the thigh, like two long centipedes.
transcript: 在休息的时候，我看到了她腿上密密麻麻的伤口，从小腿一直延伸到大腿，两条长长的蜈蚣。

translation: At that moment, I was thinking, what had she gone through in order to climb Mount Everest?
transcript: 在那一刻我在想，为了攀登珠峰，她到底经历了什么？

translation: What was the power that had been supporting her to go back to Nepal?
transcript: 是什么样的力量，支撑着她又回到了尼泊尔？

translation: What was the power that had been supporting me to return here.
transcript: 又是什么样的力量，支撑着我又回到了这里。

translation: So that two such unyielding women like us could meet here again, hold each other's hands and restart the journey as if we had forgotten the pain two years ago.
transcript: 让我们两个这样不屈的女性又在这里相遇，好像忘记了两年以前的痛苦，又重新手拉着手，在这里重新出发。

translation: So at the base camp in Everest, we agreed that as we neared the top, we could go hand in hand to the top.
transcript: 所以当时在珠峰大本营，我们约定，希望登顶的时候，我们俩能手拉手一起走向顶峰。

translation: It was another two months of long climb, two months of adaptation to high altitude, altitude sickness, two months of hardships of headache, insomnia, inability to eat, two months of hard climbs and very difficult weight-bearing。
transcript: 又是经历了两个月漫长的攀登，两个月漫长的海拔适应、高反，经历了头痛、失眠、吃不下、以及每天很辛苦的攀登和很艰难的负重。

translation: Until 4:05 am, May 22, 2017 when I came back to the peak of Mount Everest again.
transcript: 在2017年的5月22号的凌晨4点05分，我又登顶了珠穆朗玛峰。

translation: What surprised me was that when I was about to reach the peak, about twenty or thirty meters away from the summit, following my guide step by step, panting and silently moving forward, suddenly my hand was held tightly from behind by one hand.
transcript: 让我很惊喜的是，当我快要到达顶峰的时候，在顶峰距离我大概只有二三十米远的时候，我正跟着我的向导一步一步地喘着粗气，默默地向前走，但是突然我的手被一只手从后面紧紧地握住。

translation: I looked back and it turned out to be my Japanese teammate TouMou.
transcript: 我回头看到了，原来是我的日本队友TouMou。

translation: At the base camp, we agreed, we would climb to the top together.
transcript: 在大本营时候，我们约定好，我们要一起登顶。

translation: But in fact, in the actual situation, since everyone's speed and physical condition are different, it is very very difficult for two people who have made an appointment to reach the top together to deliver it.
transcript: 但其实在实际的攀登中，因为每个人的攀登的速度和身体状况不一样，就是两个人事先约好而后同时登顶，是一件非常非常难的事情。

translation: But on that day, we really went hand in hand to the top.
transcript: 但是那一天，我们真的手拉着手一起走向顶峰。

translation: On May 22, 2017, I stood on the top of Mount Everest for the second time.
transcript: 2017年5月22日，我第二次站到了珠穆朗玛峰的顶上。

translation: At this moment, I didn’t cry, and my heart was full of joy.
transcript: 这一刻我依然没有流泪，内心充满的是喜悦。

translation: At an altitude of 8,848 meters, the sun rose slowly from the horizon.
transcript: 站在海拔8848米的高度，看着太阳缓缓地从地平线上升起。

translation: At this moment, the sunrise, such a magnificent scene, slowly unfolded in front of my eyes, only for me.
transcript: 在这一刻，在这样的日出，这样壮美的景象，只为我展开，在我的眼前缓缓展开。

translation: At that moment, the height of Mount Everest's 8848 meters also increased by 1.6 meters because of me.
transcript: 而在那一刻，珠穆朗玛峰8848米的高度，也因为我的存在而增加了1.6米。

translation: My height also increased and it was a height that only belonged to me.
transcript: 增加了我的身高，变成了一个只属于我的高度。

translation: Three days after reaching the summit of Mount Everest, I climbed to the top of the 8516-meter Lhotse, the fourth highest peak in the world.
transcript: 在登顶珠穆朗玛峰之后的三天，我又登顶了海拔8516米的洛子峰，海拔世界第四高峰。

translation: Everyone may think that I was insane.
transcript: 大家可能会觉得你很我真的很疯狂。

translation: After that close contact with death in 2015 and the successful land on the peak of Mount Everest in 2016, it was fair to say that I had fulfilled my dream.
transcript: 在一五年经历了与死神擦肩而过之后，一六年登顶珠峰，好吧，你圆梦了。

translation: And then I wanted to do it all again in 2017.
transcript: 一七年你又来了。

translation: Well you might say you have reached the top.
transcript: 好吧，你登顶了。

translation: But why did you choose to top Mount Everest and Lhotse, two 8000-meter mountains, consecutively?
transcript: 可是为什么你要选择珠峰和洛子两座8000米山峰的连登？

translation: For me, since I reached the peak of Mount Everest in 2016, I knew that I was capable of doing this.
transcript: 因为对于我来说，2016年登顶珠峰，我知道我已经有了这样的能力。

translation: So when I took the challenge in 2017, I hoped to increase the difficulty for myself, gave myself a larger challenge.
transcript: 那么2017年当我再去重新挑战的时候，我希望给自己增加难度，我希望挑战更高。

translation: I wanted to know how much strength my little body could offer.
transcript: 我想知道在我小小的身躯里，究竟蕴藏着多大的力量。

translation: So when I returned to Everest in 2017, I chose to top Everest and Lhotse one after another.
transcript: 所以当我2017年重返珠峰的时候，我选择珠峰和洛子两座8000米连登。

translation: But after I finished in 2017, it was not entirely joy to me.
transcript: 但是2017年登完之后，带给我的并不完全是喜悦。

translation: It was self-examination.
transcript: 反省。

translation: Why did I self-examine?
transcript: 为什么会反省？

translation: Everyone can see in this picture where a man was lying on the snowy ground.
transcript: 大家看到照片上有一个人趴在雪地上。

translation: That was, on the morning of May 22, 2017, the day when we managed to reach the top the mountain.
transcript: 就是在2017年5月22日冲顶的那天早晨。

translation: As we were on the road to the top, at an altitude of 8600 meters above sea level, I suddenly saw this person.
transcript: 当我们在冲顶的路上爬到海拔8600米的地方，我突然看到了这样一个人。

translation: At that time, he did not lie on the snow, but leaned on a rock without his backpack or an oxygen cylinder.
transcript: 当时他并没有趴在雪地上，而是靠在一块岩石上，没有背包也没有氧气瓶。

translation: At that time, I thought it might be a corpse, because on the way to the top of Mount Everest, be it the south slope or the north slope, you could see several bodies, people who would stay there forever.
transcript: 当时我觉得可能是一具尸体吧，因为在攀登珠峰的路上，冲顶那一天，无论和南坡和北坡，都会看到好几具尸体，永远留在那里的人。

translation: So seeing this person, I thought it might be a corpse.
transcript: 所以看到这个人，我就想可能也是一具尸体吧。

translation: But when I passed him, he actually looked up, turned back, and gently asked me if I was there to rescue.
transcript: 但是当我经过他的时候，他竟然抬起头，回过头，轻轻地问了我一句rescue，问我是不是救援。

translation: It turned out that this person was alive.
transcript: 这竟然是人是一个活着的人。

translation: I could hardly imagine that in such a dark morning, there was actually a person at 8600 meters with no guide, no backpack, and no oxygen tank, who was actually still alive.
transcript: 我难以想象，在8600米在这样一个漆黑的凌晨，竟然有一个人在8600米，没有向导，没有背包，没有氧气瓶，居然还活着。

translation: I didn't know how to answer him at the time, and then my guide dragged me away.
transcript: 当时我不知道该怎样回答他，然后我的向导一把就把我拽走了。

translation: I followed the guide step by step, but my mind was agitated.
transcript: 我跟着向导一步一步地往前走，但是我的内心却不能够平静。

translation: And I kept asking myself questions.
transcript: 不断地在反复着。

translation: This person is alive!
transcript: 这是一个活着的人啊！

translation: He is still alive!
transcript: 他还活着呀！

translation: So are we just leaving him like this?
transcript: 我们就这样走了吗？

translation: My heart was full of self-blame.
transcript: 我的内心充满了自责。

translation: But the next moment, I told myself to focus on every step in front of me and focus on the path under my feet.
transcript: 但是下一刻，我告诉我自己，专注眼前的每一步，专注你脚下的路。

translation: Because if you don't concentrate, you may stay there like him.
transcript: 因为如果你不专注，可能你就会像他一样留在那里。

translation: There is no morality at 8000 meters, and you can't think in the same way you think when you are on the flat ground because the places at more than 8000 meters high are death zones.
transcript: 因为在8000米没有道德，在8000米不能够用平地的思维去思考，因为在8000米以上的醒个死亡地带。

translation: If I want to save him, I might need three, four, five, or more people to join me in saving him.
transcript: 如果我想救他，可能需要三个、四个、五个、或更多人的力量才能去救他一个人。

translation: Maybe more people will die just to save this one person.
transcript: 可能为了救这一个人会有更多的人去死亡。

translation: So there is such a cruel rule at 8000 meters.
transcript: 所以在8000米有这样一个残酷的规则。

translation: When you see someone in danger at an altitude of over 8000 meters, you could choose not to save him or her.
transcript: 在8000米以上遇险的人，你可以放弃，不救他。

translation: So I continued to go forward with self-blame deep down inside.
transcript: 所以我带着深深的自责继续往前走。

translation: When I climbed to the top and returned to 8,600 meters, I met this person again, but at that time he was still alive.
transcript: 当我登顶以后，返回到8600米的时候，又遇到了这个人，但那个时候他依然还活着。

translation: After having reached the summit, as our team still had extra oxygen and some members were in good shape, so our team rescued him at that time.
transcript: 登顶以后，我们的队伍依然有多余的氧气，而且有一些队员状态还不错，所以那个时候我们的队伍对他进行了援救。

translation: At that time, besides the Pakistani who was in danger, his 19-year-old Sherpa who climbed with him was also in jeopardy.
transcript: 当时除了这个巴基斯坦人遇险，还有跟他一起攀登的他的19岁的小夏尔巴。

translation: So the five Sherpas of our team dragged the two of them down the mountain with rope to the safe zone at 8000 meters.
transcript: 所以我们队的五个夏尔巴把他们两个人用绳子一直拖下了山，拖到了8000米的安全地带。

translation: Such a rescue seemed to be a joyful thing for all, but in fact for our Sherpas and our team members, the rescue would be placing everyone at risk.
transcript: 其实这样的救援看似皆大欢喜，但是，无论是救援他的夏尔巴，还是我们队员，每个人都面临着风险。

translation: Because our Sherpas, while rescuing, could risk falling down themselves.
transcript: 因为夏尔巴在救援他的时候，可能也会面临着滑坠、跌落的风险。

translation: And if the four team members, including me, provided our own Sherpas to participate in the rescue voluntarily, we wouldn't have a guide when we climbed down the mountains.
transcript: 而我们队员，包括我在内的四名队员，因为无偿地提供了自己的夏尔巴去参与救援，我们在下撤的时候是没有向导的。

translation: To go down alone for us would be very dangerous.
transcript: 是自己一个人走下来的，对于对于我们来说也是非常非常的危险。

translation: But I don't regret it, because when we went to the top of the mountain without rescuing him, we already were troubled by this self-blame.
transcript: 但是我并不后悔，因为当我们去冲顶的路上没有救助他，已经非常非常的自责。

translation: So when we were back, we were able to do what we could, to save them, I think it was something that we must do.
transcript: 但是当我们在返回的时候，能够有能力去做力所能及的事情，去救他们的时候，我觉得是一定要去做的。

translation: In some reports about deaths of hikers and mountain climbers, I saw this comment.
transcript: 在一些关于徒步或者登山者遇难遇险的报道中，我看到有这样的评论。

translation: Since they love nature and snow mountains, it might not be a bad thing to leave them there.
transcript: 因为他们是热爱自然，热爱雪山，所以让他们留在那里未尝不是一件好事。

translation: But as a climber, in my heart, I am timid, I am afraid of death.
transcript: 但是作为一个攀登者，在我的内心，我是胆小的，我惧怕死亡。

translation: I'm a passionate life lover, though, I've never thought about dying on a snowy mountain one day.
transcript: 我非常非常的热爱生命，我从来没有想过有一天把自己留在雪山上。

translation: For everyone who loves nature and mountaineering, only returning alive is the greatest success.
transcript: 因为对于热爱自然、热爱登山的每一个人来说，只有活着才是最大的成功。

translation: 20 days after I reached the peak of Mount Everest, I didn’t get to eat well, take a good shower, and sit on the toilet.
transcript: 当我在登完珠峰20天，没有好好地吃饭，没有好好地洗个澡，没有坐在马桶上的时候。

translation: So when I went back to the city, I took a hot bath, ate a bowl of hot noodles, and used the flushing toilet.
transcript: 当我回到城市里面，冲一个热水澡，吃上一碗热面条，坐在马桶上舒舒服服地上一个厕所。

translation: That made me feel that life could be perfect.
transcript: 我都觉得人生真的是完美。

translation: Climbing gives us the chance to face death head-on, so we cherish life even more.
transcript: 登山让我们直面死亡，所以更加珍惜生命。

translation: Why do we climb after all?
transcript: 为什么要登山？

translation: The famous British explorer George Mallory once said.
transcript: 英国著名的探险家乔治·马洛里说过。

translation: Because it's there.
transcript: 因为山在那里。

translation: And I think this is the most sensible cliché.
transcript: 而我却觉得，这是最有道理的一句废话。

translation: Why do we climb after all?
transcript: 为什么要登山？

translation: Because climbing lets us see the scenery that others can't.
transcript: 因为登山可以让我们看到别人看不到的风景。

translation: The photo on the background now is the sunrise you get to see at the peak of Mount Everest, 8,848 meters above sea level.
transcript: 现在背景上的这个照片，就是海拔8848米珠穆朗玛峰顶峰上的日出。

translation: Because of climbing, we can block noise and find the true self.
transcript: 因为登山，能够让我们抛开喧嚣，找寻真实的自我。

translation: In fact, every time I climb, the most enjoyable moment is that I could walk quietly in the snow, with only the sound of the wind whistling and the sound of my feet stepping on the snow.
transcript: 其实每一次登山，我最享受的一刻就是一个人安静地走在雪地中，耳边是风轻轻呼啸的声音和我的冰爪踩在雪地上刷刷刷的声音。

translation: Whenever this happens, my heart could calm down completely.
transcript: 每当这种时候，我的心就能完全沉下来。

translation: And I would often let my thoughts flow freely through my mind, thinking about what has happened in the past, or what is happening now, or what might happen in the future.
transcript: 经常会天马行空地任自己的思绪流淌，胡思乱想，有的时候会去想过去发生的事，或者现在发生的事，或者去想未来的一些事情。

translation: So I really enjoyed this period of time of my own.
transcript: 所以我很非常享受这样一个完全自己的、自我的时间。

translation: Mountaineering allows us to grow in hardship, pain and pleasure.
transcript: 登山让我们在艰辛、痛苦和愉悦中成长。

translation: The more pain and suffering we experience in mountaineering, the more likely I am to feel the sense of happiness when we get back to normal life.
transcript: 当我们在登山中经历的痛苦和苦难越多，那么再回到生活中，我反而却越容易感受到幸福。

translation: So this is my story about why I want to become a mountain climber.
transcript: 所以这就是我的故事，就是我为什么要登山。

translation: I also hope that you can draw some strength from my story and my story could bring some changes to your life.
transcript: 也希望大家能从我的故事中汲取一些力量，给大家的生活带来一些改变。

translation: Thank you.
transcript: 谢谢。
